author: L. Landwehr

review: I hate to be a whiner, but honestly, it just didn't work. I'm an IT guy, that's what I do for a living. I walked through the initial setup, everything was fine. Then it downloaded an update for the Chromecast itself, and boom: dead. After that, it only connects to the wifi for about 5 seconds then disconnects. No other device can see it during that time (tried iOS, Android, Windows laptop). I am guessing it's some router issue. I am on holidays right now trying to set this up on the hotel wifi. "It's so easy! It 'just' works!!" I told my parents as I handed it to them as a gift. Hopefully when they get home to Ireland it will "just" work, but I've a feeling ti will be up to me to set it up for them the next time I am over there. Perhaps the more expensive (but easier to use) Apple TV would have been a better choice for them.

review: Browser and netflix streaming was awesome from my nexus 7 tablet. Streaming from my iPhone 4s never worked, even though I downloaded Chrome, but oh well.Great for travel. Or one of those situations where you have poor wifi connectivity where the TV is (this happened while I was traveling - the router was in the kitchen and you could only get good enough signal to stream from there, but the chromecast had no problem playing video three rooms over). Or occasional home streaming.If you are looking for a permanent home solution to watch netflix or hulu, I'd recommend a roku or an apple TV because those come with remotes.

I had misunderstood what it works with - must be an internet page you're looking at - but that was my problem.
author: SueO

review: I own both the Google Chromecast and Fire TV Stick. As I mentioned in my review of the Fire TV Stick, both devices have advantages. What I like about the Chromecast is the easy interface in the iOS app and the fact that Google offers incentives from time to time, i.e. $20 Google Play credit and free movies. Casting from the YouTube and Netflix apps was seamless and the quality of the video was great.
